title: 108_hr190
content: The "United States Library Trust Fund Act" designates overpayments and contributions for the United States Library Trust Fund under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The taxpayer can designate $1 of any overpayment of tax and any cash contribution to the United States Library Trust Fund when filing their tax return. Spouses filing a joint return with an overpayment of $2 or more can each designate $1 to the trust fund. Designation can be made at the time of filing the return or at any other time. The taxpayer can designate overpayments of tax to the United States Library Trust Fund at the time of filing the return or at another time specified by the Secretary. The overpayment designated under subsection (a) is treated as refunded to the taxpayer as of the last date for filing the return of tax imposed by chapter 1. The taxpayer can designate overpayments of tax to the United States Library Trust Fund, which is treated as refunded to the taxpayer as of the last date for filing the return of tax imposed by chapter 1. The United States Library Trust Fund is created in the Treasury, funded by overpayments of tax and contributions. The fund can only be used for expenditures related to the United States Library Trust Fund Act. The table of parts for subchapter A of chapter 61 of the Code is amended to include a new item. "Part IX. Designation of overpayments and contributions for United States Library Trust Fund. The table of sections for subchapter A of chapter 98 of the Code is amended to add a new item: Sec. 9511. United States Library Trust Fund. The amendments apply to taxable years ending after the enactment of this Act. Grants to libraries are provided." Public libraries and public school libraries can receive grants from the United States Library Trust Fund by submitting an application to the Office of Library Services. The application must include certification of financial need, assurances that funds will be used for purchasing materials, a commitment to supplement funds, and agreement to provide financial records for audit purposes. The Office of Library Services selects grant awards based on economic need in accordance with regulations published by the Office for audit purposes.
